data.title: Wheelers by Ian Stewart Jack Cohen
data.meta_description: Wheelers by Stewart, Ian und Jack Cohen: and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Condition: Good. Most items will be dispatched the same or the next working day. A copy that has been read but remains in clean condition. All of the pages are intact and the cover is intact and the spine may show signs of wear. The book may have minor markings which are not specifically mentioned. Minor shelf wear.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First edition first printing. Hardback book is tight and clean with a touch of lean. Boards sharp and clean, title gilt perfect. Text block clean, with toning to edges. The pages are crisp and unblemished. Feels lightly read. Minor bump to head and foot of spine, Very good condition. Jacket some minor crimping to top edge. Light handling marks to the silver gloss. Overall near fine. For grading accuracy books are photographed without a protective book cover. This book is fitted with a non adhesive archival quality book protector to make a worthy addition to your collection. Note we do not use stock images, the book pictured is the book described. A solid example of this collectible first edition first printing title.

Hardcover first edition - First printing. The first novel for these two scientists - one a mathematician, the other a reproductive biologist, who have published many non-fiction books, and acted as advisors to other science fiction writers. Set in the 23rd century, in a world where anti-technology fanatics are now in charge. 505 pp. Cover art by Bob Eggleton, Near fine in a very near fine silver foil dustjacket (remainder line.).

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good+. Illustrated by Bob Eggleton (illustrator). 1st Edition; 1st Printing. Cover Art; This book is in Near Fine condition and has a Very Good+ dust jacket. The book and its contents are in clean, bright condition. The text pages are mostly clean and bright, but has some generalized toning. The dust jacket is crisp and clean. "Stewart has collaborated with Jack Cohen and Terry Pratchett on four popular science books based on Pratchett's Discworld. In 1999 Terry Pratchett made both Jack Cohen and Professor Ian Stewart "Honorary Wizards of the Unseen University" at the same ceremony at which the University of Warwick gave Terry Pratchett an honorary degree. In March 2014 Ian Stewart's iPad app, Incredible Numbers by Professor Ian Stewart, launched in the App Store. The app was produced in partnership with Profile Books and Touch Press. " (from Wikipedia).
